JUDGES: Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: The applicant company , ORG , is a private company which is based in GPE . It is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .

On DATE the applicant company participated in a tender held by ORG ( PERSON ) . There were no other participants and the applicant company bought CARDINAL telephones that had been imported by another private company which had later disappeared without making payment .

On DATE , after the sale became final , the applicant company requested delivery of the telephones . ORG refused delivery on the ground that ORG had requested , in a letter dated DATE , that the sale and delivery procedure be annulled on account of outstanding customs duty .
On DATE the applicant company filed a complaint with ORG ( İcra Tetkik PERSON ) and requested delivery of the telephones as well as the annulment of ORG decision .

On DATE the Judge of ORG held that , in accordance with the relevant provisions , ORG could have requested cancellation of the tender before it became final , whereas the law did not provide for the annulment of a tender after the sale had become final .
On DATE ORG notified ORG above - mentioned decision and requested delivery of the telephones to the applicant company .
On DATE the applicant company sent a letter to ORG , requesting delivery of the telephones .
The telephones had still not been delivered when the application was lodged with the ORG .
The applicant company ’s criminal complaints against CARDINAL customs officers were to no avail .
